page.statement:
To complete this module you need to pass the following assessment; the passmark is 100%.

We recommend you read the questions carefully before answering. Once you have moved on you cannot return to previous questions.

question.text: Which of the following is a true statement about visits by authorised officers, for example EHPs/EHOs?
question.ans: They need to make an appointment prior to a visit
They can visit at any reasonable time
They are not allowed to take samples and photographs
They can only visit whilst the manager is on duty

question.text: Which of the following may best be used to help prove a due diligence defence?
question.ans: Payroll records
Temperature control monitoring forms
Holiday records
Complimentary letters from customers

question.text: Which of the following is an offence under food safety legislation?
question.ans: Displaying chilled food above 8°C for 3 hours
Selling cheap food
Failing to implement a food safety management system based on the principles of HACCP
Allowing customers to serve themselves without tongs

question.text: What legal powers has an authorised officer got to deal with unfit food?
question.ans: Destroy the food
Sell the food for an alternative use
Require the food to be boiled
Seize the food

question.text: Which of the following best describes a due-diligence defence?
question.ans: Taking all reasonable precautions to prevent an offence
Proving that someone else was responsible for the offence
Claiming that the offence was impossible to predict
Proving that you were unaware of the law
